summary:
Data Scientist with a Ph.D. in Applied Probability and a Master in Engineering. 
I have a versatile profile and proven experience in data analysis, visualization, stochastic models, and simulations. My strongest assets are the quality, the integrity, and the creativity of my work. I enjoy interacting with domain experts and researchers to translate their expertise into models and data into actionable insights.

profile_positions.title: Data Designer seconded to Philips Experience Design

profile_positions.description:
I worked on paediatric cancer survivorship in collaboration with Leiden Universitair Medisch Centrum, Prinses Máxima Centrum, and Uniklinik Essen. 
I was also involved in applied-statistics projects in the air traffic domain, where I collaborate with University of Rome Tor Vergata, Lancaster University Management School, and the University of Padova.

My projects required building domain-specific knowledge about the topic of my projects, like
- cancer treatment (chemotherapy, radiotherapy, surgical procedures)
- treatment complications, side effects, and adverse events
- airspace management
- traffic control

I took care all-round of the research process 
- data manipulation and cleaning in a mixed R/Python environment
- data visualisation and exploratory analysis
- clarification and shaping of research questions
- interpreting complex data from longitudinal and cross-sectional studies
- model definition, development, and computation using a variety of techniques
- interpretation and reporting of findings to collaborators with non-statistical background

I built experience with Python libraries for data analysis statistics and machine learning: 
numpy | scipy | pandas | scikit-learn | tensorflow | matplotlib | seaborn | lifelines | rpy2 | statsmodels

profile_positions.title: Instructor

profile_positions.description:
I worked on paediatric cancer survivorship in collaboration with Radboud Medical Center Nijmegen and Medical Research Council UK.
The project aim was to assess the impact variations of chemotherapy intensity in regimens for osteosarcoma on survival outcomes

The project required building domain-specific knowledge about osteosarcoma treatment and supportive care, in order to clarify and shape clinical research questions. 
I was in charge of the whole research process
- data manipulation and cleaning in mixed R/Python environment
- interpretation and visualization of complex, longitudinal treatment data
- model definition and fitting using a variety of statistical methods from (causal) inference
- interpretation and reporting of findings to collaborators with non-statistical background
- writing of high-quality research papers
I experienced using a number of statistical softwares like SPSS, R, and Python statistical libraries (statsmodels and scikit-learn).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: Teaching Introduction to Statistics with R (Probability, Random Variables, Inference, Classical Hypothesis Testing, Linear Models)
profile_positions.title: Instructor

profile_positions.description:
I shared in the national research project PRIN 2012 “Mathematical Problems in Kinetic Theory and Applications”, granted by Italian Ministry for Education and Research.
My task was to study a particular class of Markov chains with parallel update rule, known as Simple Asymmetric Simple Exclusion Processes. These processes are useful to model vehicular traffic and study its properties.

I was appointed to a one-year postdoc position to study the properties of such systems through:
    - development of analytical tools and theoretical results
    - writing ad-hoc software for the tasks
        - simulations of such systems
        - visualizations of their dynamic behaviour
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description:
I have covered this position for 4 consecutive academic year, teaching Calculus 1 to 1st year Bachelor students Engineering Sciences.
My main task was instructing the students about explicit computations of limits of indeterminate forms with specification of infinite/infinitesimal order, and applications. 
I had also the opportunity of delivering theory lectures.
All classes were taught in English.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant
